Description: Fragment of an undyed, linen, plain weave textile with two simple edges preserved, one edge cut and one edge has a thin, applied cuff (8mm wide) in undyed linen which covers and fixes the warp threads at that edge, sewn on with undyed linen threads in running stitch; 9.5cm in from the cuff edge there are two bands of tapestry, each with a freize of alternatively one stylised tree with yellow trunk and light and dark green leaves and one stylised bouquet of flowers in yellow, green, pink, blue and beige on a purple/red background, each band is framed with a border of waves; the two simple edges appear brighter and show sewing holes and threads indicating that these edges were sewn under, and sewn together; all these elements indicate this piece is the sleeve of a tunic; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/19), weft-undyed linen (S/16); tapestry on paired? threads: warp-undyed linen (S/11), weft-undyed linen (S), yellow, pink, purple, red, light and dark green and blue wool (S/72); sewing threads in undyed linen (S spun Z ply)
Curator's comments: stored in black box; simialr to 18226 and 18214;
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
